review: For months I suffered from anxiety/panic attacks EVERY day. I started having a lot of pain in my jaw joint and I went to the dentist, he told me I don't know how you haven't broken your teeth yet from grinding my jaw so much. I was suffering a lot. In an appointment with my psychiatrist I demanded my anxiety to be treated as a core problem because it was destroying my life. That's when he realized that it could be a side effect of the antipsychotic I've been taking for months: Lurasidone 40mg. I stopped taking it and my terror just vanished! Like magic! I'm in shock at how much my life had deteriorated because of it. I realized that I had developed akathisia - the suffering is so extreme some people resort to self-harm or even suicide. Bipolar meds are very strong, we need to be VERY careful with them and always question about side effects. I give a 2 because it helped me to be more awake.

It's very physical and is confusing. Nothing helps, so once again I will go off the drug and deal with my mood disorder by myself. I have written a note to self, stopped taking latuda because of the unease, empty anxious feeling in the pit of my stomach, you can't think straight, words are hard to find and you just feel like hiding from yourself but you can't. This feeling last for hours until I finally fall asleep.

Latuda (lurasidone):So my experience with this medication is a good one. Latuda (lurasidone):I have been taking Latuda 80 mg for 8 months and am on no other medications for medication induced bipolar disorder which was caused by antidepressants prescribed for anxiety. Latuda (lurasidone):Been on Latuda 40MG for about three weeks. I'm still having some depression, sadness, but not nearly what I was when I first started on it. My Psych DOC and I are considering a jump to 80MG, but I'll be trying to get pregnant soon. Other than that, I think it's doing okay.

Latuda (lurasidone):Latuda took away the voices, but caused me to have bad thoughts and depression especially at night. It however, allowed me to lose 20 lbs. Latuda (lurasidone):I was on deep depression. Effexor was not working any more and was having deep suicidal thought. Then my doctor added Latuda 40 mg. Miracle! Taking it at lunch causes a little less sleepiness. Another feature is that it control my severe anxiety.

Latuda (lurasidone):I have Bipolar1 Disorder with history of psychotic features. I have just started taking 40 mg of Latuda per day, as I am being weened from 900 mg of lithium. Latuda (lurasidone):I have been taking Latuda for about three weeks now for bipolar II.  I don't suffer too badly from it, mostly slight depression and irritability. Latuda (lurasidone):Struggled with undiagnosed bipolar disorder for 8 years. Finally got on the right cocktail with Latuda included. I'm at 60mg and it has stopped my cycling (I'm a rapid cycler). Latuda (lurasidone):I was diagnosed with Bi-Polar II after being told I had Depression for about 2 years. My doctor prescribed me WellButrin, which I am still on and love. Latuda (lurasidone):I took this medicine while I was pregnant, it was difficult in the 1st 2 weeks. Latuda (lurasidone):I've been on Abilify seems forever. It did work well except for my sleep. So I began Latuda 4 weeks ago and so far my sleep is really improved and so has my moods. I haven't had any side effects except for the sexual one, which they all seem to take away from that. Highly recommend Latuda. Very expensive though.

Latuda (lurasidone):Since starting on 80 mg Latuda along with Buproprion my Bi-Polar mood swings are at bay, I feel no social anxiety or awkwardness and am not fearful much like I used to be. Latuda (lurasidone):I took Latuda 40 mg for a week and then 80 the next week. I had to stop halfway through week 2 because I wasn't sleeping and I was feeling more agitated. Actually, it made my bipolar worse. I was up and down and up and down within a matter of minutes.

Latuda (lurasidone):As far as I'm concerned it's a miracle medicine for bipolar. A week and a half ago I was so bad off that I didn't want to live. Latuda (lurasidone):This has been a miracle! I went from avoiding everyone and everything even cleaning or talking to friends. Latuda (lurasidone):Bipolar 2 with psychotic features (voices/some visual when it's real bad) Week 3 of Latuda now on 120mg to replace 800mg of Seroquel. Last dose of Seroquel will be this Thursday. Latuda (lurasidone):I was switched from Abilify (which was amazing), to Lamictal (horrible, didn't work), to Latuda.  I'd say that Latuda is a great medication for me. Latuda (lurasidone):I love this medication because it has cleared my head and made me feel a lot more stable. I also take Luvox, Lamictal and Klonopin for Panic Disorder and insomnia. Latuda (lurasidone):I have Bipolar 1 with psychotic features. Since being put on Latuda, my mood swings have lessened considerably, and I am no longer experiencing any psychotic symptoms. Latuda (lurasidone):Some nausea, severe vomiting when I first began...better now. It knocks me out pretty quick, so I take it at night along with 300mg of Lamictal and 150mg of Trazodone. Latuda (lurasidone):I haven't seen anyone else discuss this, but Latuda gave me A LOT of anxiety.  Within 2 hours after taking the medication I would be in full freak out mode. Latuda (lurasidone):I have been on Latuda 40mg since January 2012. I was prescribed it to help me sleep because I suffer with a severe case of insomnia. Latuda (lurasidone):I am honestly not sure how to rate this medication but I can relate my experience so far.  I have had no nausea, it does help me sleep better. Latuda (lurasidone):I was started at 40mg and got mild nausea but doing good mood wise.  Increased to 80mgs and starting getting physically sick within 20 minutes of taking it.  It would have made a good diet medicine for me, but that is not why I was on it.

Latuda (lurasidone):I have been taking 40mg Latuda for about 2 weeks.  No side effects and it does not make me drowsy. I take it with dinner and I'm fine until I go to bed at 9pm. Latuda (lurasidone):I take 40 mg of Latuda nightly with a titration dose of 25-75 mg Lamogotrine (Lamictal) for bipolar I. Latuda (lurasidone):I have been on Latuda for about 2 months now, I take 120mg at about 8-8:45pm every night. Latuda (lurasidone):Seems to really help stabilize me. I am not sure how long this medicine has been out for.

Latuda (lurasidone):I started Latuda after being on risperidone for a couple of months.  Latuda has gotten better and better. Much less anxiety, more focused, less drowsy. Latuda (lurasidone):I've been taking Latuda since about November. I also take Klonopin to help me sleep which it doesn't seem to be doing anymore. I take my Latuda in the evening. Latuda (lurasidone):I started Latuda about a month ago. Its hard to know if is truly working because I am trying to come off of 300 mg of Seroquel. Latuda (lurasidone):I've been on Latuda for several months, recently increased to 60 mg.  At first, I thought it was pretty good, subtle improvements.  Now it's hard to say. Latuda (lurasidone):I had been on Latuda for two months.  Great medicine except I had severe muscle weakness.

Latuda (lurasidone):I am diagnosed with Bipolar 2 and ADHD. I take Straterra for ADHD, which stopped the anxiousness, and I just started Latuda two days ago. It has been a dream! Latuda (lurasidone):I started taking Latuda 4 days ago for bipolar. So far I have noticed a change in my mood. Days are brighter and I'm not hungry which is a good thing. Latuda (lurasidone):Irritable, agitated, impatient, anxious and increased anger.

Latuda (lurasidone):Latuda is awesome, I've been on it for about 3 weeks and I seem to be feeling better every day.  I am also on Prozac, Dexedrine, and Klonopin. Latuda (lurasidone):I've been taking 400mg of Lamictal a day for about 3 years now and my doctor suggested adding Latuda to the mix. Latuda (lurasidone):Latuda has helped me so much with my anxiety and depression.  I'm taking 20 mg once a day and I feel great.

Latuda (lurasidone):I was recently taken off of lithium for bipolar because of my thyroid problems. I am very happy with Latuda. It works quickly and makes me feel normal for the most part. Latuda (lurasidone):I have taken Latuda for about 2 weeks for Bipolar Depression. I also take Prozac and Depakote. I have never had a medicine work so quickly and dramatically. Latuda (lurasidone):I take this for bipolar disorder and schizophrenia. Was taking 850 Mg of Seroquel 1 in the morning 1 in the afternoon and 2 at night before bed time. Latuda (lurasidone):I am on day 4 of Latuda. I am weaning off of Saphris which was like a miracle as far as effects and stabilization of mood (despite horrible taste). Latuda (lurasidone):I have been on Latuda 8 days.  I have loss of appetite but have been emotionally balanced, slight headache.  Maybe from not eating very much.  Mood is good.
